Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape with rounded base, flat ledge rim and two pierced tubular handles on the shoulder. The exterior is decorated in deep red paint with large spirals and wavy lines. The rim is decorated with cross-hatched lines and wavy lines are painted over the handles.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated Ware D67c of Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
Condition: fair (worn). Rim and upper part of handles worn.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
